etymology.description: Depicts four dots as grains of sand to indicate "a few, a little"; the form is also phonetically borrowed from 小(xiǎo, "small")
etymology.interpretation: The character 少(shǎo, "few") uses dots to suggest the idea of smallness or scarcity, similar to grains of sand. It is visually and phonetically associated with 小(xiǎo, "small").

examples.chinese: 今天来的客人很少(今天來的客人很少)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān lái de kèrén hěn shǎo.
examples.english: There were very few guests today.

examples.chinese: 他的时间很少(他的時間很少)，用来休息(用來休息)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de shíjiān hěn shǎo, yòng lái xiūxí.
examples.english: He has little time, which he uses to rest.

examples.chinese: 这部电影票房少得可怜(這部電影票房少得可憐)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bù diànyǐng piàofáng shǎo de kělián.
examples.english: The movie's box office was pitifully low.
